text: The murine <extra_id_0> BCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is induced in activated lymphocytes as an immediate early gene .
The chromosomal translocation involving 3q27 is often detected in human B-cell lymphomas , especially diffuse lymphomas with a large-cell component .
The <extra_id_0> BCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene has been isolated from the chromosomal breakpoint in these lymphomas .

Here we cloned the murine <extra_id_0> BCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> mBCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) cDNA from the muscle cDNA library using the human <extra_id_0> BCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> hBCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) cDNA as a probe .
The predicted amino acid sequence was 95 % identical to that of <extra_id_0> hBCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

It contains six repeats of the Kruppel-like zinc-finger motif that are completely identical to those of <extra_id_0> hBCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , indicating that the <extra_id_0> BCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is well conserved between humans and mice .
Expression of the <extra_id_0> mBCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was ubiquitously detected in adult mouse tissues including lymphatic organs .
Furthermore , it was induced in lymphocytes activated with phorbol ester and Ca2+ ionophore within 30 min after stimulation .
This induction was not inhibited by treatment of the cells with a protein synthesis inhibitor , cycloheximide .
These results suggest that <extra_id_0> BCL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a role in activated lymphocytes as an immediate early gene .
